borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would&nbsp;introduce a discordant feature that would close the gap between the building and which would fail to make a positive contribution to the&nbsp;character and appearance of the&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lr6hn907evvl4olzi" style="">dwellinghouse</span>, the terrace, and wider&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lr6hn906gbluj1pvk" style="">Becontree</span>&nbsp;Estate which is a non-designated heritage asset know for its homogeneous&nbsp;appearance and layout. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div><ul style=""><li style="">Paragraphs 131, 135, 195, 200, and 209&nbsp;of the National Planning Policy Framework (December&nbsp;2023)</li><li style="">Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li style="">Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li style="">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li><li style="">Paragraphs 5.1.1, 5.1.3, 5.4.1, 5.4.2&nbsp;of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li></ul></div>
description: Construction of a two storey side extension and a single storey rear extension
